org.firebirdsql.gds.ng.wire

Interface FbWireAttachment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, ExceptionListenable, FbAttachment
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FbWireDatabase, FbWireService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFbWireDatabase, AbstractFbWireService, V10Database, V10Service, V11Database, V12Database, V13Database

    public interface FbWireAttachment
extends FbAttachment
    Since:
    3.0
    Author:
    Mark Rotteveel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FbWireAttachment.AcceptPacket
      Struct-like class, reduced equivalent of Firebird p_acpd so we can store data for handling op_cond_accept.

      Receive authentication response from the server.

    • Method Detail

      • getXdrStreamAccess

        XdrStreamAccess getXdrStreamAccess()
        Returns:
        Instance of XdrStreamAccess for this attachment.

      • readGenericResponse

        GenericResponse readGenericResponse(WarningMessageCallback callback)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Convenience method to read a Response to a GenericResponse
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback object for warnings, null for default callback
        Returns:
        GenericResponse
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - For errors returned from the server, or when attempting to read.
        java.io.IOException - For errors reading the response from the connection.

      • authReceiveResponse

        void authReceiveResponse(FbWireAttachment.AcceptPacket acceptPacket)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        Receive authentication response from the server.

        This method is only relevant for protocol V13 or higher.

        Parameters:
        acceptPacket - Packet with op_cond_accept data, or null when the data should be read from the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - For errors reading the response from the connection.
        java.sql.SQLException - For errors returned from the server, or when attempting to read.
